concept.title: Configuring DNS addresses
concept.shortdesc: You can configure DNS addresses either by using the or by using the set-dns-servers command on the command line.

conbody.p: You cannot configure DNS addresses in a virtual server environment as these values are pre-configured. In other environments, there is no limit to the number of DNS addresses that you can add.
For more information about configuring DNS addresses by using the , see .
For more information about configuring DNS addresses by using the command line, see .
